sentence.Network_en: We as a society are growing more commercial and voyeuristic all the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的社会正变得越来越商业化，更好打探别人隐私。

sentence.Network_en: On the other hand, perhaps the author of the spyware just has voyeuristic tendencies.
sentence.Network_cn: 不过, 也可能程序作者只是有窥阴癖而已.

sentence.Network_en: Hitchcock also a perverse thrill out of taking audiences on a voyeuristic roller - coaster ride.
sentence.Network_cn: 希区柯克也有有害刺激的考虑受众的偷窥过山车旅程.

PerfectNetExp.abs: voyeurism 窥阴癖者voyeuristic 喜好窥阴的vraisemblance 似真实
voyeuristic pleasures , pursuits , etc., 窥阴者的乐趣 , 嗜好等.

list.abs: 与匿名者S滥交(anonymous sex)召妓癖(paying sex)以性作交易癖(trading sex)偷窥癖(voyeuristic sex)露阴癖(exhibitionist sex)性侵犯癖(intrusive sex)包括以言语.

entry.def: Voyeuristic behaviour involves getting sexual pleasure from secretly watching other people having sex or taking their clothes off.
If you describe someone's behaviour as voyeuristic, you disapprove of them because you think they enjoy watching other people's suffering or problems.

example.ex: We as a society are growing more commercial and voyeuristic all the time.
example.tran: 我们的社会正变得越来越商业化，更好打探别人隐私。

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to voyeurs or voyeurism;

auth_sentence.content: That is, it was a voyeuristic opportunity.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is, it was a voyeuristic opportunity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is, it was a voyeuristic opportunity.

auth_sentence.content: This is a compelling, voyeuristic listen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is a compelling, voyeuristic listen.

auth_sentence.content: Network TV...is dominated by...voyeuristic pandering, sensationalism, homage to violence.
